original: med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of non-existence is the meaning of impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal ni chos thams cad tshol bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni chos thams cad tshol bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Suffering is the absence of the application of seeking all dharmas.

original: tshol ba ni longs spyod do ;
analyzed: tshol ba ni longs spyod do ;
translated: Seeking is enjoyment.

original: / stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Emptiness is the non-apprehension of the nature of all dharmas.

original: bdag med pa ni chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Selflessness is the absence of attachment to all dharmas.

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'gog pa'i rnam pa bcu drug ni nang stong pa nyid kyi 'gog pa ni nang gi chos rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi 'gog pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro // 'gog pa'i rnam pa bcu drug ni nang stong pa nyid kyi 'gog pa ni nang gi chos rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi 'gog pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong
translated: Signlessness is the absence of the signs of all dharmas.

original: pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni lam shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni lam shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The sixteen aspects of cessation are the aspects of the knowledge of the path, from The cessation of inner emptiness is due to the non-apprehension of inner dharmas up to The cessation of emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is due to the non-apprehension of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩkun mkhyen @149a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis dbang du mdzad nas / kun mkhyen @149a * //
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge of paths are the knowledge of the paths that lead to the three enlightenments, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the three realms, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the four kinds of birth, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the five destinies, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the six sense spheres, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the seven abodes of consciousness, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the eight worldly dharmas, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the nine mental abodes, the knowledge of the paths that lead to the ten wholesome actions.

original: nyid gsum bye brag gis //
analyzed: nyid gsum bye brag gis //
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are the knowledge of the aspects of the four noble truths, the knowledge of the aspects of the three doors of liberation, the knowledge of the aspects of the four formless absorptions, the knowledge of the aspects of the four immeasurables, the knowledge of the aspects of the four concentrations, the knowledge of the aspects of the five higher perceptions, the knowledge of the aspects of the five spiritual faculties, the knowledge of the aspects of the five powers, the knowledge of the aspects of the seven factors of enlightenment, the knowledge of the aspects of the eightfold noble path.

original: lam gyi bden pa dang mthun par //üîΩdran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste /üîΩtha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par //üîΩslob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi rim bzhin du //üîΩsum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa dang mthun par // dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste / tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par // slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi rim bzhin du // sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge of the path of complete purification are the knowledge of the aspects of the ten perfections.

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed // ces bya ba gsungs te / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge of the aspects of the three vehicles are the knowledge of the aspects of the vehicle of the hearers, the knowledge of the aspects of the vehicle of the solitary realizers, and the knowledge of the aspects of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe ten aspects of the knowledge of the aspects of the three enlightenments are the knowledge of the aspects of the enlightenment of hearers, the knowledge of the aspects of the enlightenment of solitary realizers, and the knowledge of the aspects of the great enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa'i bar du rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu dag yin te /üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa'i bar du rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu dag yin te / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge of the aspects of the three realms are the knowledge of the aspects of the desire realm, the knowledge of the aspects of the form realm, and the knowledge of the aspects of the formless realm.üîΩThe ten aspects of the knowledge of the aspects of the four kinds of birth are the knowledge of the aspects of birth from a womb, the knowledge of the aspects of birth from an egg, the knowledge of the aspects of birth from heat and moisture, and the knowledge of the aspects of spontaneous birth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge of the aspects of the five destinies are the knowledge of the aspects

original: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa gang dag la yod pa da dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa gang dag la yod pa da dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The last are the aspects of Buddhahood itself.

original: kun mkhyen nyid rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gis nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas dag gi lam gyi bden pa gang yin pa de dag dang mthun par go rims bzhin du sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sum cu rtsa bzhi dang sum cu rtsa dgu dag go //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gis nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas dag gi lam gyi bden pa gang yin pa de dag dang mthun par go rims bzhin du sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sum cu rtsa bzhi dang sum cu rtsa dgu dag go //
translated: The truth of the path of the disciples, the bodhisattvas, and the Buddhas, respectively, is divided into thirty-seven, thirty-four, and thirty-nine aspects, in accordance with the three varieties of the knowledge of all things.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs dag gis nyan thos kyi lam la brten pa'i phyir dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / bden pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs dag gis nyan thos kyi lam la brten pa'i phyir dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / bden pa bzhi dang /
translated: The path of the disciples is based on the thirty-seven aspects of the enlightenment, the three doors of liberation, the eight liberations, the nine successive cessations, the four noble truths, the ten totalities, and so on.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brten pa'i phyir dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brten pa'i phyir dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang /
translated: Because of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the tathƒÅgatas,

original: rang byung nyid dang / sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang byung nyid dang / sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: self-arising, and buddhahood, the path of buddhahood is relied upon.

original: 'dir chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúbecause of completely transcending all dharmas‚Äù means because of completely transcending the dharmas of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: chos ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do //
translated: Because of teaching just as the dharmas are, there is the tathƒÅgata.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi brjod pa thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi brjod pa thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all the statements of the Buddha are suchness.

original: byung bar gyur pas na byung ba ste /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pas na byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù means arisen from that.

original: byung bar gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byung bar gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of has arisen is has come into being.

original: rang byung zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'dod pas 'di byung bas na rang byung ngo //
analyzed: rang byung zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'dod pas 'di byung bas na rang byung ngo //
translated: Self-arisen means self-arisen because it arises by its own desire.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: chos @149b thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos @149b thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it has mastery over all phenomena.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas nyid ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas nyid ce na //
translated: How is it buddhahood?

original: chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the full enlightenment of all phenomena,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa rnams thams cad gcig tu byas na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa rnams thams cad gcig tu byas na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
translated: When all the aspects are combined into one, there are 73 aspects.

original: da ni sbyor ba brjod par bya ba yin pas bcom ldan 'das ma mnyan pa cung zad kyang rnyed par dka' na /
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba brjod par bya ba yin pas bcom ldan 'das ma mnyan pa cung zad kyang rnyed par dka' na /
translated: Now, since the application should be stated, it is difficult to find even a little hearing of the Bhagavatƒ´.

original: ci rab tu sbyor ba lta zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci rab tu sbyor ba lta zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
translated: Having made offerings to the Buddhas,

original: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
analyzed: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
translated: from them, the roots of virtue are produced,

original: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
translated: having taken up the protection of the spiritual friend,

original: 'di nyan pa yi snod yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyan pa yi snod yin no //
translated: one is a vessel for listening to this.

original: sangs bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod dang // len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: sangs bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod dang // len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: receiving, holding, and so on,

original: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //
analyzed: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //
translated: are accepted as the vessel by the holy ones.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas pa dang / de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa gang yin pa de dag 'di nyid nyan pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas pa dang / de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa gang yin pa de dag 'di nyid nyan pa ste /
translated: Those who have served the Buddhas of the past, who have planted roots of virtue with them, and who are sustained by spiritual friends are the very ones who listen to this teaching.

original: rna lam du grag pa'i snod yin gyi /
analyzed: rna lam du grag pa'i snod yin gyi /
translated: They are the vessel for hearing it, for bringing it to their ears.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Others are not.

original: gang yang sngon gyi skye bar sangs rgyas mang po yongs su bsten pa dang / kun 'dri ba dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa de nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das ma len pa dang 'dzin pa nas /
analyzed: gang yang sngon gyi skye bar sangs rgyas mang po yongs su bsten pa dang / kun 'dri ba dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa de nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das ma len pa dang 'dzin pa nas /
translated: Those who have served many Buddhas in their previous lives, and who practice the six perfections together with asking questions, are the very ones who receive and hold the perfection of wisdom taught by the Blessed One, up to

original: de bzhin nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa'i bar nyid kyi snod nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa'i bar nyid kyi snod nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: up to the perfection of wisdom, they become a vessel for it.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Not otherwise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma rna lam du grag pa gang yin pa de dag ni nges par bkur sti byas pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma rna lam du grag pa gang yin pa de dag ni nges par bkur sti byas pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: For this very reason, those who hear the Blessed Lady are known to possess three qualities, such as respect, etc.

original: gang la len pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni bkur sti byed pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang sangs rgyas bsten pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la len pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni bkur sti byed pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang sangs rgyas bsten pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those who practice taking, etc., in accordance with reality possess three qualities, such as respect, etc., and are said to be endowed with serving the Buddha, etc.

original: gang de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From there, ≈öakra, Lord of the Gods, having bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, stood to one side and said to the Blessed One:üîΩBlessed One, please explain the perfection of wisdom to me.üîΩI will listen and take it to heart.üîΩThe Blessed One said:üîΩKau≈õika, listen and take it to heart.üîΩI will explain the perfection of wisdom to you.

original: yid la zung shig dang ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'i bar ni sbyor ba po rnyed par dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: yid la zung shig dang ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'i bar ni sbyor ba po rnyed par dka' ba nyid do //
translated: This is the difficulty in finding a practitioner.

original: sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: From the point of view of application,

original: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
translated: because they do not dwell on form, etc.,

original: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: because they have stopped application to that,

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab @150a * //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab @150a * //
translated: and because the reality of those is profound,

original: phyir ; / de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phyir ; / de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: those are difficult to fathom.üîΩBecause they are immeasurable,

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshogs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshogs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: because they realize the great collection over a long time,üîΩbecause of prediction, because of irreversibility,üîΩbecause of definite emergence, because of the absence of obstacles,

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan 'don 'phel med 'grib med phyir ;
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan 'don 'phel med 'grib med phyir ;
translated: because of the nearness of enlightenment, because of swiftness,üîΩbecause of the non-increase and non-decrease of the welfare of others,

original: / chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
analyzed: / chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
translated: because of not seeing dharma and adharma, etc.,

original: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: because of not seeing form, etc. as inconceivable,üîΩbecause of not conceptualizing the signs of form, etc.

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
translated: and their nature,üîΩbecause of bestowing the precious result,

original: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas // zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
translated: and because of the purity of the stages,üîΩit is the stage of the bodhisattva.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, that refers to application.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnam par sbyor bar bcas pa zhes gong du bstan pa de la rnam par bstan nas sbyor ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par sbyor bar bcas pa zhes gong du bstan pa de la rnam par bstan nas sbyor ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression along with the application is used because the occasion for the demonstration of the application has been reached.

original: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because of the non-abiding in form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag la mi gnas pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag la mi gnas pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application is the non-abiding in those forms, etc.

original: gang koo shi ka zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang koo shi ka zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with Kausika,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba gsungs so //üîΩde la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba gsungs so // de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: up to the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended, he explains the application of the non-abiding in form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la sbyor ba bkag pa'i spyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la sbyor ba bkag pa'i spyor ba ste /
translated: There, the application is the application of the non-abiding in form, etc.

original: gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with Moreover, Subhuti,

original: dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
translated: up to the middle is not apprehended, he explains the application of the non-abiding in form, etc.

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
translated: Because of the profundity of its suchness.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma zab bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma zab bo //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavatƒ´ is profound because the suchness of form, etc. is profound.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni zab pa'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni zab pa'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti said‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúprofound,‚Äù the application of profundity is stated.

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they are difficult to fathom.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because form, etc. are difficult to fathom,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma gting dpag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma gting dpag dka' ba'o //
translated: the Bhagavatƒ´ is difficult to fathom.

original: gang gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What was said,

original: gting dpag dka'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gting dpag dka'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba gsungs so //

translated: As soon as they hear it, they will have interest.

original: / zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ni sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis skad cig ma gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ni sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis skad cig ma gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: The second moment is the one characterized by accomplishment, as stated in the passage beginning as soon as they hear it, they will have interest and ending they will have interest.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: Perfect accomplishment is the result.

original: thos ma thag tu mos pa la sogs pa de dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thos ma thag tu mos pa la sogs pa de dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: As soon as they hear it, they will have interest, and so on, and that will become perfect complete enlightenment.

original: yang 'di thos nas nam nur dang rmongs pa dang @158a * //
analyzed: yang 'di thos nas nam nur dang rmongs pa dang @158a * //
translated: Having heard this, they will not hesitate, be confused, or be frightened, and they will quickly attain the highest complete enlightenment.

original: zhum pa gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub dman pa'o //üîΩgang gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhum pa gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub dman pa'o // gang gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /

original: de las gcig la gnas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yang dag par 'grub pa'i khyad par gyis skad cig ma gsum pa'i'o //
analyzed: de las gcig la gnas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yang dag par 'grub pa'i khyad par gyis skad cig ma gsum pa'i'o //

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgya mtsho chen por gru zhig pa'i mis ro dang shing dang shing leb la sogs pa la 'jus na de ni bar dor dus ma byas par skam la gnas par 'gyur ba /

translated: The object is like the case of a man whose boat is wrecked in the great ocean. If he grasps a corpse, a piece of wood, or a plank, etc., he will reach land safely without drowning.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /

translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects will reach perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without manifesting an inferior enlightenment in the interim.

original: gang rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage beginning Subhuti, it is thusüîΩrefers to the perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par gyis 'gog pa'i skad cig ma bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par gyis 'gog pa'i skad cig ma bzhi pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúSubhuti, it is thus‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening‚Äù is the fourth moment of cessation, distinguished by its object.

analyzed: rten dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rten dang lhan cig pa ni rten dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pas yongs su smin pa'i rim gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi bar ma dor dman pa'i byang chub tu mi ltung ste
translated: And that bodhisattva, through the stages of ripening by the perfection of wisdom, skillful means, and so on, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, not falling into an inferior awakening in the meantime.

original: / dper na bum pa legs par tshos par chu blugs te /
analyzed: / dper na bum pa legs par tshos par chu blugs te /
translated: For example, if a well-fired pot is filled with waterüîΩand

translated: Subhuti, it is like this, etc.,

analyzed: byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ni rten gyi khyad par gyis lam gyi bden pa'i skad cig ma dang po'o //

analyzed: bar ma dor byang chub dman par ni ma yin te /

translated: For example, a ship that is well-constructed and well-maintained, when set out on a favorable wind and water, will reach the desired place and will not break up in between.üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is like this, and so on up to will not fall to the level of a pratyekabuddha.

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ni mtha' dag gi khyad par te /

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa'i'o //

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for grasping,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ni yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par gyis skad cig ma gsum pa'o //üîΩro myong med dang zhes bya ba ni 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ni yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par gyis skad cig ma gsum pa'o // ro myong med dang zhes bya ba ni 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi
translated: What is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is thus‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúarises in the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù is the third moment, the special retention.

original: bar la rtog pa mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: bar la rtog pa mi byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout relishing‚Äù means that here the bodhisattva dedicates all his roots of virtue to unsurpassed enlightenment, but does not conceive of form up to the knowledge of all aspects as perfect enlightenment.

original: dpyod par mi bde ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpyod par mi bde ces bya ba'i don to //

translated: The passage beginning Venerable Subhuti and ending Noble sir, all dharmas are empty of own-being is the fourth moment of the Truth of the Path, distinguished by the absence of relishing.

analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba de la /
translated: Having thus taught the characteristic of distinction, he now has to teach the characteristic of function. In this connection:üîΩBeneficial, happy, a refuge,üîΩa protection, a resort, a final relief,

translated: ‚Äú Benefit‚Äù means that having liberated beings from the five destinies, one establishes them in nirvana.üîΩTherein, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the bodhisattva great being who wishes to liberate all beings from the five destinies and establish them in nirvana should practice the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs kyis dkris pa dag gi mun pa de snang bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang gling yin te /
translated: That which illuminates the darkness of those who are wrapped in the cocoon of ignorance is also an island,

original: snang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to light.

original: gzhan yang gling thob par byed pa'i phyir gling ste ;
analyzed: gzhan yang gling thob par byed pa'i phyir gling ste ;
translated: Moreover, an island is that which causes one to reach an island,

original: ded dpon no //
analyzed: ded dpon no //
translated: a captain.

original: de'i las kyang gleng yin te /
analyzed: de'i las kyang gleng yin te /
translated: The function of the island is also mentioned.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i rin po che'i gling du 'dren pa de bas na gling ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i rin po che'i gling du 'dren pa de bas na gling ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the guide to the precious island of nirvana. Therefore, the island is threefold.

original: gang rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The function of the island is mentioned in the passage beginning with Subhuti, how is it that the Bodhisattva, the great being, is like an island unto beings? and ending with he is the guide.

original: ded dpon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gling gi byed pa gsungs so //üîΩyongs su 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po bskyed nas gzugs nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: ded dpon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gling gi byed pa gsungs so // yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po bskyed nas gzugs nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: The function of the guide is mentioned in the passage beginning with he is the guide and ending with he is the leader.üîΩHaving generated great compassion, he teaches the Dharma of non-production, non-cessation, non-defilement, and non-purification, from form up to the Arhat.

original: gang rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The function of the guide is mentioned in the passage beginning with Subhuti, how is it that the Bodhisattva, the great being, is like an island unto beings? and ending with he is the leader.

original: yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yongs su 'dren pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yongs su 'dren pa gsungs so //
translated: The function of the leader is mentioned in the passage beginning with he is the leader and ending with he is the leader.

original: 'bad pa ni rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa ni rtsol ba ste /
translated: Exertion is effort.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i g-yo 'gul lo //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i g-yo 'gul lo //
translated: It is the movement of coming and going.

original: de 'gags pa'i phyir lhung gis grub pa ste /
analyzed: de 'gags pa'i phyir lhung gis grub pa ste /
translated: Because of that cessation, there is the establishment of falling.

original: gang rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba nas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lhung gis grub pa'i byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba nas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lhung gis grub pa'i byed pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, up to going and coming are not apprehended in the absence of fabrication - this teaches the establishment of falling.

original: theg pa gsum gyis /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis /
translated: By the three vehicles,

original: 'bras bu mngon sum byed pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum byed pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la /
translated: the self that actualizes the result.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par byang ba de dag go rims ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba bkag pa na 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par byang ba de dag go rims ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba bkag pa na 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: With the words all phenomena, one should understand the defiled and the purified. When going and coming are negated in that order, it is the actualization of the result.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni rang rgyal ba'i theg pa dang / sdug bsngal du ma la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni rang rgyal ba'i theg pa dang / sdug bsngal du ma la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /
translated: The words like a dream, etc. refer to the Pratyekabuddha vehicle, the words many sufferings, etc. refer to the Sravaka vehicle, and the words suchness, etc. refer to the Bodhisattva vehicle.

original: gang rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi mi skye ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi mi skye ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The activity of that which causes the realization of the result of the three vehicles is stated by Subhuti, the non-production of all dharmas...

original: g-yo ba med de /
analyzed: g-yo ba med de /
translated: is not moved,

original: 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis theg pa gsum gyi 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa de'i byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis theg pa gsum gyi 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa de'i byed pa gsungs so //
translated: and neither coming nor going is apprehended.

original: tha ma 'gro ba'i mdzad pa ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha ma 'gro ba'i mdzad pa ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The activity of going is the last.

original: 'gro ba ni 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: Here, going is the attainment of the result.

original: de nyid byed pa ste /üîΩgang rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul @160a * //
analyzed: de nyid byed pa ste / gang rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul @160a * //
translated: That itself is the activity.

original: can zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: can zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is stated by Subhuti, all dharmas have the nature of form...

original: 'di la mos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la mos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: up to 'one will have confidence in this.'

original: 'di yang 'gro ba dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis thob par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang 'gro ba dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis thob par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i byed pa yin no //
translated: This is also the activity of going for the purpose of attaining the cessation of going by way of non-apprehension.

original: 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: This is the characteristic of activity.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba de'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of the reality of the knowable is taught in order to understand the reality of the knowable.üîΩThe signs of the afflictions, the characteristics,üîΩthe counteragents, the adverse,üîΩthe solitude, the difficulty, the certainty,üîΩthe non-apprehension of the object,

original: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya ba mi dmigs dang // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang / mi mthun thogs pa med dang de //
analyzed: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya ba mi dmigs dang // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang / mi mthun thogs pa med dang de //
translated: the cessation of attachment,üîΩand that which is called the objective support,üîΩthe unobstructed, the non-adverse,üîΩthe groundless, the unborn, the non-going,üîΩand the non-apprehension of suchness itself,

original: gzhi med skye med 'gro med dang // de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //
analyzed: gzhi med skye med 'gro med dang // de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //
translated: are the sixteen natures.

original: mtshan gzhi lta bur mtshon pas na //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi lta bur mtshon pas na //
translated: Since they illustrate the basis of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
translated: they are considered the four characteristics.

original: zhes gsungs te /üîΩnyon mongs pa dag gis dben pa ni gsol ba /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te / nyon mongs pa dag gis dben pa ni gsol ba /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Solitude from the afflictions is taught from Blessed One up to solitary nature.

original: dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nyon mongs pa'i dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nyon mongs pa'i dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the nature of solitude from the afflictions.

original: rtags ni nyon mongs pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: rtags ni nyon mongs pa'i rtags te /
translated: The signs are the signs of the afflictions.

original: de dag gis dben pa ni gang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas tshul gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nyon mongs pa'i rtags dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis dben pa ni gang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas tshul gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nyon mongs pa'i rtags dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, those who are isolated from those‚Äù up to ‚Äúare isolated from the nature of the perfection of wisdom‚Äù teaches the essence of being isolated from the signs of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma ni yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde dag gis dben pa ni gang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma ni yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste / de dag gis dben pa ni gang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The signs of affliction are grasping and so on.

original: mtshan ma dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nyon mongs pa'i mtshan mas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so ;
analyzed: mtshan ma dben pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nyon mongs pa'i mtshan mas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so ;
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, those who are isolated from those‚Äù up to ‚Äúare isolated from the nature of the signs of the perfection of wisdom‚Äù teaches the essence of being isolated from the signs of affliction.

original: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The antidotes to the discordant classes are the absence of attachment and so on.

original: de dag gis dben pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis dben pa ste /
translated: They are isolated from those.

original: gang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pas dben pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pas dben pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, those bodhisattva great beings who are isolated from attachment and the absence of attachment‚Äù up to ‚Äúare isolated from the nature of the perfection of wisdom‚Äù teaches the essence of being isolated from the antidotes.

original: ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i dben pa gsungs so //üîΩdka' dang zhes bya ba ni gang gsol ba bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i dben pa gsungs so // dka' dang zhes bya ba ni gang gsol ba bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: The passage from they are not separated from the perfection of wisdom up to they become endowed with the state teaches the separation from the adverse factors and the antidote.üîΩThe passage from difficult up to they are the ones who do the difficult teaches the essence of difficulty.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa nyid de /üîΩrab 'byor zhes @160b bya ba nas /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa nyid de / rab 'byor zhes @160b bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from certainty up to they are the ones who do the difficult teaches the essence of certainty.

original: go cha 'tshal bam lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nges pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: go cha 'tshal bam lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nges pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: The passage from Subh≈´ti up to they are the ones who do the difficult teaches the essence of armor.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ched du bya ba'i go cha ste /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyas  bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ched du bya ba'i go cha ste / bcom ldan 'das kyas  bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The armor for the sake of which is the armor for the sake of completely liberating all sentient beings and for the sake of omniscience.

original: go cha bgos so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ched du bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: go cha bgos so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ched du bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The passage from the Blessed One said up to they are the ones who do the difficult teaches the armor for the sake of which.

original: mi dmigs dang zhes bya ba ni gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs dang zhes bya ba ni gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase without reference means without reference to the three spheres.

original: bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mi dmigs pa gsungs so //üîΩmngon par zhen pa bkag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mi dmigs pa gsungs so // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
translated: The phrase the non-apprehension of is explained in the passage beginning with the words he said and ending with the words cultivation.

original: de nas yang zhes bya ba nas de bzhin nyid du nan tan du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mngon par zhen pa med pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes bya ba nas de bzhin nyid du nan tan du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mngon par zhen pa med pa gsungs so //
translated: The phrase the cessation of adherence is explained in the passage beginning with the words then and ending with the words because of the practice of reality.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang // zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //üîΩde yang dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang // zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do // de yang dbyer med pa ste /
translated: The phrase that which is called the object is explained in the passage beginning with the words the object is the reality of all things and ending with the words it is also indivisible.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ni sangs rgyas sa ma rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i de bzhin nyid de //üîΩgang gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ni sangs rgyas sa ma rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i de bzhin nyid de // gang gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase the reality of the Buddha stage is explained in the passage beginning with the words because that reality is the reality of the knowledge of all modes and ending with the words the reality of the knowledge of all modes is the reality of the Buddha stage.üîΩ The phrase the profundity of all things is explained in the passage beginning with the words he said and ending with the words the profundity of all things.

original: chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: The phrase the reality of all things is explained in the passage beginning with the words the reality of all things and ending with the words the reality of the knowledge of all modes.üîΩ The phrase the reality of the knowledge of all modes is explained in the passage beginning with the words the reality of the knowledge of all modes and ending with the words the reality of the knowledge of all modes is the reality of the Buddha stage.

original: mi mthun zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: mi mthun zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba ste /
translated: The phrase difficult to believe means that all worldly beings find it difficult to believe.

original: chos de dag gzung ba'i phyir ram mi gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos de dag gzung ba'i phyir ram mi gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The teachings were not given for the purpose of grasping or not grasping those phenomena.

original: gzung ba ni 'jig rten pa bdag dang bdag gi zhes spyod pa ste /üîΩlha'i bu dag ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzung ba ni 'jig rten pa bdag dang bdag gi zhes spyod pa ste / lha'i bu dag ces bya ba nas /
translated: Grasping is the worldly practice of self and mine.

original: bsgom par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgom par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'jig rten thams cad kyis yid ches par dka' ba gsungs so //
translated: The phrase sons of gods up to cannot be cultivated indicates that all worldly beings find it difficult to believe.

original: thogs pa med dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thogs pa med pa ste /üîΩde nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: thogs pa med dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thogs pa med pa ste / de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase unobstructed means that from form up to omniscience there is no obstruction.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: The phrase then the venerable Subh≈´ti up to non-arising indicates the nature of non-obstruction.

original: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase groundless, non-going, non-arising means that the ground of the phenomena that are being taught is not a ground.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bstan bzhin pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bstan bzhin pa'i chos te /
translated: The phrase that refers to the phenomena that are being taught.

original: gzhi med pa dang 'gro ba med pa dang skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa dang 'gro ba med pa dang skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is groundless, it is non-going, and it is non-arising.

original: 'dir gzugs la sogs la rten med pa'i phyir gnas pa med pa ste /üîΩgang chos 'di ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs la sogs la rten med pa'i phyir gnas pa med pa ste / gang chos 'di ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, there is no abiding because form, etc. have no basis.

original: rten ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: rten ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThis dharma‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúis groundless‚Äù teaches the nature of groundlessness.

original: 'di la 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pas 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pas 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: Since there is no going here, it is non-going.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gro ba med pa 'ong ba med pa de @161a * //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gro ba med pa 'ong ba med pa de @161a * //
translated: Just as the suchness of the Tathagata is non-going and non-coming,

original: bzhin du rab 'byor gyi yang ste /üîΩde nas 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bzhin du rab 'byor gyi yang ste / de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: so also is Subhuti‚Äôs.

original: tshig tu brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //üîΩ'di la skye ba yod pa ma yin pas na skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so // 'di la skye ba yod pa ma yin pas na skye ba med pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThen, in the desire realm‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúis expressed in words‚Äù teaches the nature of non-going.üîΩSince there is no arising here, it is non-arising.

original: gang rjes su skye ba dang gang gi rjes su skye ba dang / gang gis rjes su skye ba de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rjes su skye ba dang gang gi rjes su skye ba dang / gang gis rjes su skye ba de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no subsequent arising, nothing that arises subsequently, and nothing by which there is subsequent arising.

original: de nas gnas brtan zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúElder,‚Äù

original: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs so //
translated: up to ‚Äúnot apprehended‚Äù explains the nature of non-production.

original: de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs su med pa nyid yin na gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dmigs pa lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs su med pa nyid yin na gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dmigs pa lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: ‚Äú Suchness is not apprehended‚Äù means that if form, etc. are not apprehended, how could the suchness of form, etc. be apprehended?

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti,‚Äù

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: up to ‚Äúfalls to the level of a pratyekabuddha,‚Äù explains the nature of the non-apprehension of suchness.

original: ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa bcu drug ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa bcu drug ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú The nature of sixteen aspects‚Äù means that the just-explained sixteen aspects are the nature.

original: de ni mtshan nyid bzhi pa ste ;
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid bzhi pa ste ;
translated: That is the fourth characteristic,

original: byed pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid gsum po dag las lhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid gsum po dag las lhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it surpasses the three characteristics of establishing activity.

original: ji ltar 'di mtshan nyid du bzhed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mtshan nyid du bzhed ce na /
translated: How is this accepted as a characteristic?

original: mtshan gzhi ru ni mtshon pas na //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi ru ni mtshon pas na //
translated: Because it is indicated as the basis of characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang gi phyir 'di mtshan gzhi ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di mtshan gzhi ste /
translated: Because this is the basis of the characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan zhing 'di mtshon par bya ba yin pas mtshan gzhi'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan zhing 'di mtshon par bya ba yin pas mtshan gzhi'o //
translated: It is the basis of the characteristics because it possesses the characteristics and is to be illustrated by them.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the characteristics of reality.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de bas na /üîΩmtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de bas na / mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: Since the factors conducive to liberation are to be expressed, therefore:

original: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //üîΩrnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni // rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
translated: Skill in the correct practice of generosity and so onüîΩis asserted to be the factors conducive to liberation

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: in the realization of all aspects.üîΩFaith that focuses on the Buddha and so on,üîΩthe effort that takes generosity and so on as its domain,üîΩthe mindfulness that is complete in terms of intention,üîΩthe nonconceptual samadhi,

original: sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // rnam par mi rtog ting nge 'dzin dang // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // rnam par mi rtog ting nge 'dzin dang // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: and the wisdom that knows phenomena in all aspects

original: shes pa'i shes rab dang rnam lnga //üîΩrdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes rab dang rnam lnga // rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //
translated: are asserted to be the five faculties.üîΩThe sharp realize complete enlightenment easily,

original: rtogs sla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed //
analyzed: rtogs sla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed //
translated: but the dull realize it with difficulty.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni mtshan nyid dang cig shos dag gis ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni mtshan nyid dang cig shos dag gis ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The first verse gives the characteristics, and the next two give the divisions.

original: sbyin pa gtong ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom pa 'di la mtshan mar mi byed cing yang dag par grub pa'i tshogs la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni skabs 'dir thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod do zhes bya ba
analyzed: sbyin pa gtong ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom pa 'di la mtshan mar mi byed cing yang dag par grub pa'i tshogs la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni skabs 'dir thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod do zhes bya ba
translated: The skill in the equipment for perfect enlightenment, which consists in not making a show of generosity, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects, is here called the factor conducive to liberation.

original: ni mtshan @161b nyid do //
analyzed: ni mtshan @161b nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic.

original: rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni de'i rab tu dbye ba lnga kho na ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni de'i rab tu dbye ba lnga kho na ste /
translated: The five aspects are just the five divisions of it.

original: dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
translated: They are faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de la sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: Among them, faith is the focus on the Buddha, etc.

original: gang sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
translated: As it says in the noble Holy Teaching of Vimalakirti, ‚ÄúSharadwati, a bodhisattva great hero who has five qualities attains the skill in means of a bodhisattva.üîΩWhat are the five?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: This passage explains the faith-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.

original: sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe sphere of generosity, etc., and striving‚Äù up to ‚Äúskill in means‚Äù explains the striving-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.üîΩThe passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of thought and mindfulness‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom‚Äù explains the mindfulness-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.

original: thabs mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom and skill in means‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe perfection of skill in means‚Äù explains the wisdom-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.

original: bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gsol pa /üîΩbcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of skill in means and the perfection of vows‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe perfection of vows‚Äù explains the volition-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.üîΩThe passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of vows and the perfection of power‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe perfection of power‚Äù explains the power-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.

original: byang chub ni the tshom ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dran pa'i bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o //üîΩrnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub ni the tshom ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dran pa'i bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o // rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of power and the perfection of knowledge‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe perfection of knowledge‚Äù explains the knowledge-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni ba phyir bltas pa nyid kyi phyir te /üîΩde ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni ba phyir bltas pa nyid kyi phyir te /üîΩde ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of knowledge and the perfection of skill in means‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe perfection of skill in means‚Äù explains the skill in means-aspect of the factor of enlightenment conducive to liberation.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyad par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o //üîΩchos rnams rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyad par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: The passage from I will practice the perfection of giving up to I will practice the knowledge of all aspects indicates the nature of meditative stabilization.

analyzed: shes pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni / de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis shes rab kyi bdag nyid gang gsungs pa'o // rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rnon po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rnon po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The passage from the perfection of wisdom up to the knowledge of all aspects indicates the nature of wisdom.

original: rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed ces bya ba ni de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed ces bya ba ni de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu zhes bya ba nas /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe dull one is said to have difficulty understanding‚Äù is from the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThen the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra‚Äù up to ‚Äúthat bodhisattva great being will emerge.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang bden pa'i tshul bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir yang bden pa'i tshul bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par thar pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @162a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par thar pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @162a * //
translated: Based on the conventional truth, it is said that ‚Äúthe bodhisattva great being, in terms of the suchness of all phenomena,‚Äù and so on, up to ‚Äúwill emerge to the definite liberation of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.‚Äù

original: tshig gi don khong du chud pa na skrag pa la sogs pa dang bral ba ni rnon po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: tshig gi don khong du chud pa na skrag pa la sogs pa dang bral ba ni rnon po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin la /
translated: When one comprehends the meaning of these words, one is free from fear and so on. This is the sharp type of the factor conducive to liberation.

original: skrag pa la sogs pa bshad pa ni rtul po yin no zhes bya ba ni rtul po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: skrag pa la sogs pa bshad pa ni rtul po yin no zhes bya ba ni rtul po'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the factors conducive to liberation are for the sharp faculties.

original: de ltar thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the factors conducive to liberation,üîΩin order to explain the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩdro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir / dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
translated: it is said:

original: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags //üîΩde dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags // de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
translated: The focal object of the heat factors is said to be all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: They are explained to have ten aspects, such as the equality of mind towards them.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la'o //
translated: Here means in the complete realization of all aspects.

original: dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sems can thams cad do //
translated: The focal object of the heat factors is all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa bcu ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The ten aspects are the equality of mind towards all sentient beings and so on.

original: sems mnyam pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / nga rgyal bcom pa'i sems dang / g-yo ba med pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / mi 'tshe ba'i sems dang / ma dang bu mo dang sring mo'i sems dang /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / nga rgyal bcom pa'i sems dang / g-yo ba med pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / mi 'tshe ba'i sems dang / ma dang bu mo dang sring mo'i sems dang /
translated: the mind of equality, the mind of love, the mind of compassion, the mind of destroyed pride, the mind of non-deception, the mind of benefit, the mind of non-anger, the mind of non-violence, the mind of mother, daughter, and sister,

original: pha dang spun zla dang bu'i sems zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha dang spun zla dang bu'i sems zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the mind of father, brother, and son.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said...

original: dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dro bar gyur pa gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dro bar gyur pa gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: up to should be apprehended refers to the heat stage.

original: bdag nyid sdig pa las zlog cing //üîΩsbyin la sogs la gnas dang gzhan //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdig pa las zlog cing // sbyin la sogs la gnas dang gzhan //
translated: Turning oneself away from evilüîΩand establishing oneself in generosity and so forth,

original: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //
analyzed: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //
translated: establishing others in thoseüîΩand praising them in accordance with reality

original: rtser 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtser 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: are the peak.

original: bdag nyid mi dge ba bcu las ldog pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar la gnas pa dang / gzhan dag ldog pa dang gnas pa de dag la 'god pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi dge ba bcu las ldog pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar la gnas pa dang / gzhan dag ldog pa dang gnas pa de dag la 'god pa dang /
translated: One abides in the turning away from the ten nonvirtues, in generosity, etc., and in the equipoise on dependent origination; and one establishes others in those turnings away and abidings.

original: de dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa nyid ni rtse mo yin te //
analyzed: de dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa nyid ni rtse mo yin te //
translated: The peak is the praise of those and the conformity to them.

original: gang bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rtse mor gyur pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rtse mor gyur pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The peak is stated by ‚ÄúI should abide in the turning away from the ten nonvirtues, etc., up to the equipoise on dependent origination, and I should establish others in those turnings away and abidings.‚Äù

original: de bzhin bzod pa ni //üîΩrang gzhan rten can bden shes pa //
analyzed: de bzhin bzod pa ni // rang gzhan rten can bden shes pa //
translated: Likewise, the acceptance isüîΩThe knowledge of the truth with a basis in self and other.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dag gi bden pa'i shes pa skyes pa ni bzod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dag gi bden pa'i shes pa skyes pa ni bzod pa ste /

original: gang bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal shes par bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal shes par bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The acceptance is stated by ‚ÄúI should know suffering,‚Äù etc., up to ‚ÄúI should abandon ignorance and should generate knowledge.‚Äù

analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis @162b gsungs pa ni bzod par bzhed pa'o //
translated: up to ‚Äúabides in a manner of non-apprehension‚Äù is said to be the acceptance.üîΩThe supreme dharma is the same,üîΩknown through ripening sentient beings, etc.

original: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //üîΩsmin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //
analyzed: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams // smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //

analyzed: de yang de dag ni 'jig rten gyi don du dmyal ba tshol ba yin te /

original: dmyal bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu drug pa'o //
translated: That is the sixteenth sign for them.üîΩThey cannot be led astray by others.

original: gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: That is the seventeenth sign for them.

original: lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
analyzed: lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
translated: Mara reveals another path to them,

original: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /

original: gzhan dang lam ni lam gzhan te //
analyzed: gzhan dang lam ni lam gzhan te //
translated: Another path is a different path.

original: lam la ltos na gzhan nyid skabs kyis nye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lam la ltos na gzhan nyid skabs kyis nye ba'i phyir te /
translated: because of the proximity of the otherness in relation to the path.

original: @164a * // lam ma yin pa dang lam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @164a * // lam ma yin pa dang lam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot the path‚Äù and ‚Äúthe path‚Äù is this.

original: bdud dang 'brel pas lam nyid la lam ma yin par smra ba'i bdud nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtags bcu gcig yin la /
analyzed: bdud dang 'brel pas lam nyid la lam ma yin par smra ba'i bdud nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtags bcu gcig yin la /
translated: The knowledge that the very mƒÅra who speaks of the path as not the path is a mƒÅra is the eleventh sign.

analyzed: lam ma yin pa nyid la lam nyid du smra ba bdud nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtags gnyis pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that the very mƒÅra who speaks of what is not the path as the path is a mƒÅra is the second sign.

original: de la dang po ni gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / snyan dngags mkhan gyis rang bzor byas pa nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / snyan dngags mkhan gyis rang bzor byas pa nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, the first is from ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti‚Äù and so on up to ‚Äúshould be known as the work of poets.‚Äù

analyzed: gnyis pa ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyung shig ces bya ba nas /

original: de ni gnas ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu dgu pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu dgu pa nyid do //

original: sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
translated: The conduct pleasing to the buddhas

original: zhes bya ba de ni de dag nyid la rtags nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni de dag nyid la rtags nyi shu pa'o //
translated: is the twentieth sign.üîΩThe verse summary:

analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mjug bsdu ba ste /

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rtag sa nyi shu po de dag gis mtshon pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rtag sa nyi shu po de dag gis mtshon pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa ste /

original: phyir mi ldog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog ces bya ba'i don to //

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //

translated: The reversal of the notion of form, etc.üîΩThe reversal of the notion

original: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
analyzed: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
translated: The state of application and post-application,

original: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
analyzed: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
translated: the individual cessation of abiding, and the non-apprehension of even an atom of phenomena,üîΩon one's own stage, that very thing, and abiding in the three stages,

original: rang gi sa la des nyid dang // sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba ;
analyzed: rang gi sa la des nyid dang // sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba ;
translated: giving up one's life for the sake of the Dharma,

analyzed: / de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: such are the sixteen moments

analyzed: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: These are the signs of irreversibility.

translated: Here, the cessation of discriminations such as form means the cessation of discriminations from form up to Buddha,

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: which is the receptivity to the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering.
