analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having said this...

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gsungs pa de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rtags dang po yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gsungs pa de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rtags dang po yin no //
translated: up to should be known as irreversible - this is the first sign of the path of seeing.

original: sems brtan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems brtan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Firm mind means

original: bdud la sogs pas mi byed pa nyid ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ste /üîΩgang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdud la sogs pas mi byed pa nyid ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ste / gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The non-performance by demons, etc. is the Dharma knowledge of suffering.

original: skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de nyid kyi rtags te gnyis pa yin no //üîΩtheg pa dman rnams las ldog pa //
analyzed: skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de nyid kyi rtags te gnyis pa yin no // theg pa dman rnams las ldog pa //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Subhuti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúenters into the faultless‚Äù is the second sign of that.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste /üîΩgang de nas tshe dang ldan par rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste / gang de nas tshe dang ldan par rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The line ‚Äúturns away from the lower vehicles‚Äù refers to the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de nyid kyi rtags te gsum pa'o //üîΩbsam gtan la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de nyid kyi rtags te gsum pa'o // bsam gtan la sogs pa'i /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThen the venerable Subhuti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúcannot be turned away from perfect complete enlightenment‚Äù is the third sign of that.üîΩThe line ‚Äúthe complete exhaustion of the branches of dhyana, etc.‚Äù

original: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ni lus yin no //
analyzed: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ni lus yin no //
translated: The branches of dhyana and formless states are the body.

original: de yongs su zad pa ni dengs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yongs su zad pa ni dengs pa nyid de /
translated: Their complete exhaustion is their disappearance.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa thob pa la stobs chung ba de ni sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa ste /üîΩgang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa thob pa la stobs chung ba de ni sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa ste / gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni rtags bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni rtags bzhi pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Subhuti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone should know that he is irreversible‚Äù indicates the fourth sign.

original: lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lightness of body and mind.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bcas pa'i spyod lam la lus yang ba nyid dang / lus lci bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lus dang sems yang ba nyid de /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bcas pa'i spyod lam la lus yang ba nyid dang / lus lci bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lus dang sems yang ba nyid de /
translated: Lightness of body and mind is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúHe is endowed with mindfulness and full awareness‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhis body does not become heavy.‚Äù

original: de gnyi ga ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste /üîΩgang rab @165a * //üîΩ'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de gnyi ga ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste / gang rab @165a * // 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Both of these are the receptivity to the knowledge of the origin.

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de la rtags lnga pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de la rtags lnga pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Subhuti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone should know that he is irreversible‚Äù indicates the fifth sign.

original: 'dod la spyod pa thabs mkhas dang // zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du thabs la mkhas pas 'dod pa sten par byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa ste /üîΩgang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'dod la spyod pa thabs mkhas dang // zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du thabs la mkhas pas 'dod pa sten par byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa ste / gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Skill in the enjoyment of desire refers to the skill in means of the householder bodhisattva who enjoys desire in order to develop living beings.üîΩThis is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa ni de dag nyid kyi rtags drug pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa ni de dag nyid kyi rtags drug pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, furthermore, etc., up to should be known as irreversible is the sixth sign of those.

original: rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang ; / zhes bya ba la khyim pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba sbyin par byed pa dang rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa'i phyi bzhin lag na rdo rje rtag tu 'brang ngo zhes bya ba
analyzed: rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang ; / zhes bya ba la khyim pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba sbyin par byed pa dang rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa'i phyi bzhin lag na rdo rje rtag tu 'brang ngo zhes bya ba
translated: The line always pure in conduct refers to the householder bodhisattva who gives away the entire world filled with the seven jewels, and Vajrapani always follows him, who is always pure in conduct.

original: ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: This is the acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the origin.

original: gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The passage beginning Moreover, Subhuti, and ending with the perfection of wisdom is the section on the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gnyis pa'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de la rtags bdun pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gnyis pa'i bar gyis gsungs pa de ni de la rtags bdun pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúshould be known as irreversible‚Äù indicates the seventh sign.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yin te /üîΩgang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ;
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yin te / gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ;
translated: ‚ÄúPurity of livelihood‚Äù is subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin.

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs bde ni de la rtags brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs bde ni de la rtags brgyad pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúshould be known as irreversible‚Äù indicates the eighth sign.

original: phung sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phung sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe aggregates, etc.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni zhi gnas dang rjes su sbyor ba ste lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni zhi gnas dang rjes su sbyor ba ste lhag mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúApplication‚Äù is serenity, and ‚Äúsubsequent application‚Äù is insight.

original: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba la //
analyzed: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba la //
translated: ‚ÄúApplication‚Äù and ‚Äúsubsequent application‚Äù

original: gnas pa ni sems kyi spyod pa ste de yongs su bkag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni sems kyi spyod pa ste de yongs su bkag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding‚Äù is the activity of the mind, and that is stopped.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With regard to what?

original: phung po la sogs pa dang por byas la mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dang por byas la mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase first make the aggregates, etc., not objects of observation means such things as the abiding in the application and subsequent application to the aggregates, etc.

original: de la phung po la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid de'i sgrub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la phung po la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid de'i sgrub pa nyid yin te /
translated: The refutation of the abiding in the application and subsequent application to the aggregates, etc., is the very establishment of emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? He says, Because...

original: de ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste /üîΩgang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste / gang rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That is the acquiescence in the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to cessation.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni @165b de la rtags dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni @165b de la rtags dgu pa yin no //
translated: The ninth sign is indicated by the passage beginning with Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in this deep perfection of wisdom, and ending with he does not review the perfection of wisdom.

original: bar chad byed rnams zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bar chad byed rnams zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase those which are adverse refers to those phenomena which are unfavorable.

original: rkun po dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang gtam gyi yul yin pa'i phyir rkun po'i gtam bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa ste /üîΩde rkun po'i gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rkun po dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang gtam gyi yul yin pa'i phyir rkun po'i gtam bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa ste / de rkun po'i gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The teaching on the talk of thieves is the knowledge of dharmas regarding cessation, because it is similar to thieves and is the object of talk.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de la rtags bcu pa'o //üîΩtshogs dang zhes bya ba ni dpung gi sgra brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de la rtags bcu pa'o // tshogs dang zhes bya ba ni dpung gi sgra brjod pa yin te /
translated: The statement beginning with ‚Äúthe talk of thieves‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone does not see‚Äù is the tenth sign regarding that.üîΩ‚ÄúArmy‚Äù is a term for an army.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi tshogs so //
translated: It is the army of the side of the antidote.

original: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste /üîΩde dmag gi gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste / de dmag gi gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That is the receptivity to the knowledge of the subsequent cessation.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu pa bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu pa bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The statement beginning with ‚Äúthe talk of an army‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone does not see‚Äù is the eleventh of the ten signs regarding that.

original: dbang sogs bcas pa'i g-yul 'gyed ces bya ba la g-yul 'gyed pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi g-yul 'gyed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang sogs bcas pa'i g-yul 'gyed ces bya ba la g-yul 'gyed pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi g-yul 'gyed pa ste /
translated: The battle of the forces, etc. is the battle of the forces of the side of the counteragent.

original: g-yul 'gyed pa yod na 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed pa yod na 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is a battle, there is the attainment of cessation.

original: lus dang gnas dang longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa dag shin tu ldog pa ni 'gog pa'o //üîΩde la lus ni dbang po'i grong yin pa de nyid kyis na grong gi sgras gsungs so //
analyzed: lus dang gnas dang longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa dag shin tu ldog pa ni 'gog pa'o // de la lus ni dbang po'i grong yin pa de nyid kyis na grong gi sgras gsungs so //
translated: The cessation of the appearances of the body, the abode, and the enjoyments is cessation.üîΩThe body is the city of the sense-faculties, and therefore it is called a city.

original: lus kyi rten ni gnas yin pa de nyid kyis na grong khyer gyi sgras gsungs so //
analyzed: lus kyi rten ni gnas yin pa de nyid kyis na grong khyer gyi sgras gsungs so //
translated: The abode of the body is the abode, and therefore it is called a town.

original: longs spyod ni yul gyi tshogs yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod ni yul gyi tshogs yin te /
translated: The enjoyments are the collection of objects,

original: de yang grong rdal gyi sgras gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang grong rdal gyi sgras gsungs te /
translated: and they are called a village.

original: dbang pos nges par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang pos nges par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are to be understood by the sense-faculties.

original: 'gog pa de yang bdag med pa la sogs pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa de yang bdag med pa la sogs pa thob pa yin te /
translated: And that cessation is the attainment of selflessness, etc.

original: de dag shin tu med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag shin tu med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they are utterly nonexistent.

original: / de bas na g-yul 'gyed pa dang grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtam dag la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig gi gtam dang /
analyzed: / de bas na g-yul 'gyed pa dang grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtam dag la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig gi gtam dang /
translated: Therefore, the state of being engaged in and devoted to the topics of battle, village, town, city, etc. is individually rejected, and the state of being engaged in and devoted to the topic of the perfection of wisdom alone,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa'i gnas pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa'i gnas pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: and to the mental attention of omniscience, is established.

original: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ste /üîΩde g-yul gyi gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ste / de g-yul gyi gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: This is the subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation.

original: yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu gnyis pa'o //üîΩser sna la sogs la zhes bya ba @166a * //
analyzed: yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid la rtags bcu gnyis pa'o // ser sna la sogs la zhes bya ba @166a * //
translated: The twelve signs with regard to those are stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe topic of battle‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúnot separated from mental attention.üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩWith regard to the passage beginning with ‚Äúavarice, etc.,‚Äù

original: ser sna la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: avarice, etc. are the resistances to the six perfections.

original: chos 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: That which possesses the desire for Dharma and so on is the receptivity to the knowledge of the Dharma of the path.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That which is stated from ‚Äúthe perfection of generosity and so on‚Äù up to

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúshould be known as irreversible‚Äù is the thirteenth sign in just that .

original: chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
analyzed: chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
translated: The Dharma is not observed even as a particle.

original: rang gi sa la nges pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi sa la nges pa nyid //
translated: One is certain in one‚Äôs own stage.

original: ces bya ba la chos rdul tsam yang mi dmigs pa de lta na yang bdag the tshom med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur pa de gnyis ni lam la chos shes pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la chos rdul tsam yang mi dmigs pa de lta na yang bdag the tshom med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur pa de gnyis ni lam la chos shes pa ste /
translated: Even though the Dharma is not observed even as a particle, one is without doubt that one will become a perfect buddha. Those two are the receptivity to the knowledge of the Dharma of the path.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That which is stated from ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti‚Äù up to

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúdoes not see‚Äù is the fourteenth sign in just that .

original: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And who abide in the three stages,

original: chos rnams ni skye ba med pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la ni thob par bya ba nyid dang / theg pa chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams ni skye ba med pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la ni thob par bya ba nyid dang / theg pa chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa nyid de /
translated: Dharmas are non-arisen, and perfect complete enlightenment is to be attained, and the Great Vehicle is taught by the Tathagata.

original: gnas gsum zhes bya ba nis gsum mo //
analyzed: gnas gsum zhes bya ba nis gsum mo //
translated: The three stages are the three stages.

original: de la gnas pa ni bdud rnams kyis kyang nges par mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni bdud rnams kyis kyang nges par mi phyed pa ste /
translated: Abiding in those, even the Maras cannot break them.

original: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //üîΩrab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o // rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That is the receptivity to the cognition of the path.üîΩSubhuti, it is like this, etc., up to you should know that he is irreversible.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bco lnga pa'o //

original: chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
analyzed: chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
translated: Giving up life for the sake of Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos yin la de'i don du srog kyang gtong ba zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos yin la de'i don du srog kyang gtong ba zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are emptiness is a phenomenon, and one should give up one's life for the sake of that is subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, furthermore, up to

original: so so yang dag par rig pa mngon par bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa mngon par bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid la rtags bcu drug pa'o //
translated: one should accomplish the analytical knowledges is the sixteenth sign in that.

original: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: Those sixteen moments

original: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas ni //
analyzed: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas ni //
translated: of the wise abiding on the path of seeing

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
translated: are the signs of irreversibility.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the summary.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the path of meditation,

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
translated: the path of meditation is profound.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: mdo las zab mo'i tshig gis bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo las zab mo'i tshig gis bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The path of meditation is stated in the sutra with the word profound.

original: mang po'i tshig ni zlos pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni zlos pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: The word many is a repetition.

original: gang la gnas na chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas na chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the basis for perfecting all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti said...

original: legs @166b par bstan du gsol zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: legs @166b par bstan du gsol zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ...please teach well.

original: de'i zab pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i zab pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is its profundity?

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs // zhes pa ste /
translated: Profundity is emptiness, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Lord said...

original: zab mo zab mo zhes bya ba de dag go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo zab mo zhes bya ba de dag go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ...these are the profound ones.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i zab pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i zab pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the profundity of emptiness, etc.?

original: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid de /
analyzed: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid de /
translated: That profundity is freedom from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de bzhin nyid la gzugs med pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gzugs med pa nas /
translated: In suchness there is no form...üîΩ...up to no enlightenment. This is freedom from the extreme of superimposition.üîΩForm is not other than emptiness...

original: byang chub med ces bya ba'i bar gyis sgra 'dogs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid dang / gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: byang chub med ces bya ba'i bar gyis sgra 'dogs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid dang / gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa nas /
translated: ...up to enlightenment is not other than emptiness. This is freedom from the extreme of denial.

original: byang chub las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de zhes bya ba'i bar ni skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid de /üîΩgsol pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: byang chub las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de zhes bya ba'i bar ni skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid de / gsol pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should course in perfect wisdom without taking his stand on anything.üîΩ He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom?

original: de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should stand in perfect wisdom by way of nonduality.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yang gang zhe na /üîΩyang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yang gang zhe na / yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom by way of nonduality?üîΩ He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of form, etc.üîΩ He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of form, etc.?üîΩ He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the five grasping skandhas.üîΩ He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the five grasping skandhas?üîΩ He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the twelve sense media.üîΩ He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the twelve sense media?üîΩ He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the four concentrations.üîΩ He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the four concentrations?

original: gcig tu dben par song nas thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis nges pa'i don la rigs pa bzhis rnam par dpyod pa ni sems pa'o //üîΩrigs pa ni ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu dben par song nas thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis nges pa'i don la rigs pa bzhis rnam par dpyod pa ni sems pa'o // rigs pa ni ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: He said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the four formless concentrations.

original: de nas ji ltar bsam pa'i don la rnam pa dgu mthar thug pa ni zhi gnas te /
analyzed: de nas ji ltar bsam pa'i don la rnam pa dgu mthar thug pa ni zhi gnas te /
translated: He said, How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in perfect wisdom by way of the nonduality of the four formless concentrations?

original: 'jal ba'o // de nas don dgu po de 'byed pa dang / rab tu 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jal ba'o // de nas don dgu po de 'byed pa dang / rab tu 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni lhag mthong ste /
translated: Then, the discernment of those nine meanings, which has the characteristic of analysis, thorough analysis, thorough examination, and thorough investigation, is insight.

original: nges par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the definite discernment.

original: gsum pa de dag nyid la yang dang yang du zhes bya ba'i yang dang yang du'o //
analyzed: gsum pa de dag nyid la yang dang yang du zhes bya ba'i yang dang yang du'o //
translated: The repetition of those three is the repetition.

original: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is the characteristic of the path of cultivation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, etc., up to

original: 'jal ba dang rtog par gyis shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jal ba dang rtog par gyis shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: you should investigate and discern.

original: de ltar yin na bsgom pa'i lam gyis dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na bsgom pa'i lam gyis dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, what is the object of the path of cultivation?

original: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
translated: The limbs of definite discernment and the path of seeing,

original: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: and the path of cultivation itself,

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
translated: are its continuum.

original: bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: bzhed pa ste /
translated: It is accepted.

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: As taught, the self, etc., up to

original: rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: and it does not approach the cause.

original: de la gnas par bya zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la'o //
analyzed: de la gnas par bya zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la'o //
translated: Therein, one should abide refers to the aids to penetration.

original: bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //üîΩbsgrub par bya zhes bya @167a * //
analyzed: bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la'o // bsgrub par bya zhes bya @167a * //
translated: One should train refers to the path of vision.

original: ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la'o //
translated: One should accomplish refers to the path of meditative development.

original: de bzhin du sgrub pa dang sems pa dang yongs su rtog pa dang / brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog dag la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub pa dang sems pa dang yongs su rtog pa dang / brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog dag la'o //
translated: Similarly, one should practice, one should reflect, one should fully understand, and one should exert oneself refer respectively to heat, the summit, receptivity and the supreme mundane factor.

original: rtsol pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: rtsol pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
translated: Exertion refers to the path of vision.

original: 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la'o ;
analyzed: 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la'o ;
translated: Exertion refers to the path of meditative development.

original: / gzhung lhag ma ni phan yon no //
analyzed: / gzhung lhag ma ni phan yon no //
translated: The remaining text is concerned with the benefits.

original: rnam pas rnam pa dgur bzhed ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rnam pas rnam pa dgur bzhed ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is considered to be ninefold in terms of the aspects refers to the path of meditative development.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Again, the nine aspects are due to the differentiation of the aspects of the adverse side.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: The small, middling, and greatüîΩare divided into small of the small, etc.

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis te chung ngu'i chung ngu dang ; chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis te chung ngu'i chung ngu dang ; chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang /
translated: The small of the small, the small of the middling, the small of the great, the middling of the small, the middling of the middling, the middling of the great, the great of the small, the great of the middling, and the great of the great.

original: chen po'i chen po'o zhes bya ba'i go rims 'di nyid kyis gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam pa dgu'i 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po'o zhes bya ba'i go rims 'di nyid kyis gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam pa dgu'i 'thad pa yin te /

original: de dag skyes pas lugs las bzlog pa'i rim bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang /
analyzed: de dag skyes pas lugs las bzlog pa'i rim bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang /
translated: By their arising, one abandons the aspects of the resistances in the order of the reverse order, i.e., great of the great, middling of the great, lesser of the great, great of the middling, middling of the middling, lesser of the middling,

original: chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu'o zhes bya ba spong ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu'o zhes bya ba spong ste /

original: gos la dri ma chen po sngar dag par byas nas phyis chung ngu dag par byed pa de bzhin du sems la yang ngo //
analyzed: gos la dri ma chen po sngar dag par byas nas phyis chung ngu dag par byed pa de bzhin du sems la yang ngo //

original: 'di man chad tshig chen po brgyad kyis bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis phyed gong ma rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i gang zag phung po la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi

translated: From here on, the first half of the verse up to ‚Äúthe Sugata has many such dharmas‚Äù shows that the person who is devoid of the perfection of wisdom and who does not focus on the aggregates and so on has

analyzed: mtshan nyid chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad gsungs te /

original: te / de dag gi 'ba' zhig pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa chung ngu dang bcas pa yin yang 'bras bu che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa nyid kyi rmi lam dang sad par bzung nas chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nyid yin na ji ltar rmi lam na sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa dag gis bsod nams dang sdig par mi 'gyur te ma

analyzed: gal te sad pa'i rnam par rtog pas rmi lam gyi las dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu yod pa yin na / gnyid ma log pa de'i tshe las gnyid ma log pa'i rnam par rtog pas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /

analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: rmi lam gyi nang du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir mtshan mar mi byed pa nyid chos mthun pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir mtshan mar mi byed pa nyid chos mthun pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul bstan pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúin a dream‚Äù is used here to show the mode of non-apprehension by way of similarity in the non-making of signs.

original: gang mi dmigs pa la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgoms te /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgoms te /
translated: If one, having stood in non-apprehension, cultivates the six perfectionsüîΩand dedicates them to enlightenment, is that a dedication?

translated: The very non-apprehension of perfect complete enlightenment, which has the characteristic of arriving at the ultimate non-apprehension, is the principal method. Therefore, the very non-apprehension of apprehension is a dream.

translated: The reply to the objection that a dream is not empty of conceptualization, since it is non-conceptual, is that it is like a dream because it is not the antidote to conceptualization.

translated: are impure.

analyzed: de la dag par bsgrub pa yis //

original: rmi lam gyi nang du yang byang chub dman pa dang / khams gsum po dag la 'dod pa mi skye ba la sogs pa ni rtags gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du yang byang chub dman pa dang / khams gsum po dag la 'dod pa mi skye ba la sogs pa ni rtags gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second sign is that even in dreams he does not generate desire for the lesser enlightenment or for the three realms.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du 'khor gyi nang na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong zhing des bstan pa thos nas bsgrubs pa la sogs pa ni rtags gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du 'khor gyi nang na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong zhing des bstan pa thos nas bsgrubs pa la sogs pa ni rtags gsum pa'o //
translated: The third sign is that even in dreams he sees the TathƒÅgata in the midst of an assembly, hears the teachings, and practices them.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' la 'phags nas chos ston pa dang rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtags bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' la 'phags nas chos ston pa dang rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtags bzhi pa'o //
translated: In a dream, the Tathagata rises up into the sky and teaches the Dharma, and displays miracles and wonders.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du grong dang grong khyer bcom pa bsregs pa la sogs pa mthong na skrag par mi byed sad nas kyang khams gsum po rmi lam lta bur shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtags lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du grong dang grong khyer bcom pa bsregs pa la sogs pa mthong na skrag par mi byed sad nas kyang khams gsum po rmi lam lta bur shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtags lnga pa'o //
translated: In a dream, one sees a town or city destroyed, burned, and so on, and one is not afraid. Having awakened, one knows that the three realms are like a dream.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du dung 'gro dang yi dags dang dmyal ba mthong nas de 'di snyam du ji ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rnam pa thams cad du ngan song gsum po med par 'gyur ba da ltar 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtags
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du dung 'gro dang yi dags dang dmyal ba mthong nas de 'di snyam du ji ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rnam pa thams cad du ngan song gsum po med par 'gyur ba da ltar 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtags
translated: In a dream, one sees a donkey, hungry ghost, or hell being, and thinks, ‚ÄúJust as I am now, I will enter into the Buddha-field, and in every way, the three lower realms will be eliminated.‚Äù

original: drug pa'o // gal te rmi lam mam sad pa na grong la sogs pa tshig pa mthong na gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: drug pa'o // gal te rmi lam mam sad pa na grong la sogs pa tshig pa mthong na gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf I am prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: de'i tshe me 'di zhi bar gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin rlabs byas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe me 'di zhi bar gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin rlabs byas na /
translated: may this fire be extinguished.‚ÄùüîΩIf that fire is extinguished, etc.

original: gal te me de zhi bar gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni 'dir rtags bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gal te me de zhi bar gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni 'dir rtags bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh reason.üîΩWhen a man or woman is possessed by a non-human being, the Bodhisattva should think:

analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes pa dang bud med mi ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs na byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bdag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lhag pa'i bsam pa dang bcas pa'i sems yod pa la / ji ltar bdag nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems med pa'i bden pa @172a * //

analyzed: 'dis skyes pa dang bud med dag las mi ma yin pa 'di gud du 'gro bar gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs byas na /
translated: If he makes a truth vow:üîΩ‚ÄúBy this truth may this non-human being leave this man or woman,‚Äù

original: gal te bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs des gud du song na de ni 'dir rtags yin no //
analyzed: gal te bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs des gud du song na de ni 'dir rtags yin no //
translated: If the power of the truth causes him to go away, then that is a sign here.

original: de nas bdud kyi byin rlabs kyis gud du song ba las lung ma bstan par yang lung du bstan par mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni don med pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de nas bdud kyi byin rlabs kyis gud du song ba las lung ma bstan par yang lung du bstan par mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni don med pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Then, by the power of Mara, he goes away, and the conceit of being taught when not taught is the cause of meaninglessness.

original: de'i tshe de gud du song ba ni rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de gud du song ba ni rtags ma yin no //
translated: At that time, his going away is not a sign.

original: 'di ltar bdud kyi tshig kyang rnam pa mang du yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdud kyi tshig kyang rnam pa mang du yod la /
translated: Thus, the words of Mara are of many kinds.

original: gang gi phyir lung ma bstan pa la lung bstan pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni nyams pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni rtags brgyad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung ma bstan pa la lung bstan pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni nyams pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni rtags brgyad pa yin te /
translated: And because the conceit of being taught when not taught is the cause of decline, this is the eighth sign.

analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig brgyad pa nas brtsams te /

analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal can du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //

original: gang zag de lta bu bsten par mi bya /
analyzed: gang zag de lta bu bsten par mi bya /
translated: such a person should not be attended upon.

original: de yongs su spangs shing de dag la byams pa la sogs pa'i sems bskyed par bya /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs shing de dag la byams pa la sogs pa'i sems bskyed par bya /
translated: One should completely abandon those and generate a mind of love and so forth toward them.

original: ji ltar bdag gi nyes pa 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du med par gyur pa de ltar bya'o zhes rang gis mngon par shes nas pha rol gnon par bya zhing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten par bya'o zhes
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi nyes pa 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du med par gyur pa de ltar bya'o zhes rang gis mngon par shes nas pha rol gnon par bya zhing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten par bya'o zhes
translated: Having understood by oneself, ‚ÄúI will act in such a way that these faults of mine will be completely eliminated,‚Äù one should strive and rely on spiritual friends such as the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: bya ba ni rtags dgu pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe Bodhisattva, the great being‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthe present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones‚Äù indicates

analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'dod pa la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba ni rtags bcu pa yin te /
translated: the desire to be independent of others and so forth. Abiding in the perfection of wisdom is the tenth sign.

original: rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, Subhuti,‚Äù and so forth, up to

analyzed: 'di las rgya cher bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is taught in detail up to here.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin la chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin la chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: That perfection of wisdom is also the characteristic of non-attachment because of being without characteristics, and all phenomena are also like that.

analyzed: de ltar yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yod de /

analyzed: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pas 'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because of revolving in cyclic existence through grasping ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù.

translated: because of the absence of grasping where those do not exist. Therefore, because of the absence of cyclic existence, this is the eleventh reason.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti said, etc., up to

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @172b de ltar spyod pa ni 'ga' la yang mi spyod de /

analyzed: de ltar gang spyod pa dang / gang la spyod pa'i chos de dag mi dmigs so //

original: de ltar zil gyis mi gnon pa'i sa la gnas na 'ga' zhig gis kyang zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtags bcu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zil gyis mi gnon pa'i sa la gnas na 'ga' zhig gis kyang zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtags bcu gnyis pa ste /

analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /

analyzed: nye bar 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äúit will be increased.‚Äù

analyzed: de ltar rtags bstan nas rnam par 'phel ba'i dbang du mdzad de /

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed //

translated: and so on, up to ‚Äúthe merit of worshipping the Buddhas,‚Äù

analyzed: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //

analyzed: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do // zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe increase is sixteen-fold.‚Äù

original: ci 'dra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo gang yin pa de dag snyed kyi grangs kyis mtshon pa'i sangs rgyas gang yin pa de sangs rgyas de dag gi mchod pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de la sogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo gang yin pa de dag snyed kyi grangs kyis mtshon pa'i sangs rgyas gang yin pa de sangs rgyas de dag gi mchod pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de la sogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has the merit of worshiping that many Buddhas, who are as numerous as the people of Jambudvipa, is called that.

analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas gnas pa de gnyis ni rnam par 'phel ba dang po ste /
translated: The one who explains the perfection of wisdom, etc., and the one who abides with the attention endowed with that, those two are the first increase.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de nyin dang mtshan du de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas gnas kyi yid la byed pa gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: Day and night, he abides with the attention endowed with that, not giving an opportunity to other attentions.

analyzed: ji ltar yang yid la byed pa thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang chos rnams kyi chos nyid de la rtag tu gnas te /
translated: However, one should not be separated from the knowledge that all mental activities are emptiness, and that, in that way, one always abides in the reality of phenomena,üîΩwithout increase or decrease.

original: 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med do zhes shes bzhin du de ltar mi 'bral lo zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba gnyis pa ste /üîΩdes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'phel ba med pa dang 'grib pa med do zhes shes bzhin du de ltar mi 'bral lo zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba gnyis pa ste / des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /

analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pa'o //

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

original: de la de nyid spyod dam /
analyzed: de la de nyid spyod dam /
translated: Subh≈´ti asks, ‚ÄúDoes the Blessed One practice that?‚Äù

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One replies, ‚ÄúNo, he does not.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod dam /
translated: Subh≈´ti asks, ‚ÄúDoes the Blessed One practice the emptiness of emptiness?‚Äù

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One replies, ‚ÄúNo, he does not.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid las gud na yang gang de la spyod pa dmigs sam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na yang gang de la spyod pa dmigs sam /
translated: Subh≈´ti asks, ‚ÄúIs that practice observed apart from the emptiness of emptiness?‚Äù

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang ma yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na gang de la spyod pa dang bcom ldan 'das ma gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga mi dmigs shing chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: Thus, the one who practices and the Blessed Lady are both not apprehended. No dharma is apprehended.

analyzed: de skye ba'am 'gag ba med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yin te /
translated: This non-arising and non-cessation is the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas by bodhisattvas.üîΩEndowed with that, they are irreversible from complete perfect enlightenment, are predicted, and proceed to that, and fully awaken to that.

original: gang dang ldan na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa der lung bstan par 'gyur zhing der gzhol ba nas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba gsum pa ste /

translated: This is the third increase.

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, those sons of good family or daughters of good family who practice this perfection of wisdom as it has been taught will not be frightened, will not tremble, will not shiver, will not be cowed, will not be terrified, will not be overcome with terror.

original: nam yang yongs su 'grib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang yongs su 'grib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mi skye ba dang skye bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram /
translated: ‚ÄúAre bodhisattvas predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in order to make all dharmas not arise and to make them arise?‚Äù

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, they are not.‚Äù

original: gang yang lung bstan pa dang / gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de thams cad ni dmigs su med de /
analyzed: gang yang lung bstan pa dang / gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de thams cad ni dmigs su med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is predicted and that which is fully awakened to are all non-apprehensible.üîΩBecause the perfection of wisdom is non-conceptual.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the fourth development.üîΩSubh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúLord, if all dharmas are non-apprehensible, how can a bodhisattva be predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?‚ÄùüîΩThe Lord said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is because all dharmas are non-apprehensible that a bodhisattva is predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'phel ba bzhi pa ste /

analyzed: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: Likewise, it is possible to measure with the tip of a hair split a hundred times the water in the oceans of the first, second and third chiliocosms.

original: ma yin no //

analyzed: des gnyis kyi 'du shes med pa dang / gnyis med pa'i 'du shes med pas bsod nams kyi phung po de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa de bas na de ltar de srid bsod nams kyi phung po la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni

analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i 'du shes nub pa sems dang don gzhan la yang mi 'jug pa'i sems ni sems rang bzhin du gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: The meditative stabilization that is the settling of the mind in its natural condition is the meditative stabilization that is the settling of the mind in its natural condition because the settling of the mind in its natural condition is the essence of meditative stabilization.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /üîΩbyang chub tu @175a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / byang chub tu @175a * //

translated: There, the example is ‚Äúbodhisattva mahƒÅsattva,‚Äù and the antidote is ‚Äúthe Blessed One does not exist,‚Äù etc.
